Pros: Flexible hours, independence, low stress
Cons: Absolutely no path for advancement. Regularly shut down when attempting to apply outside of the team or even just gain visibility and interact across the company.

Review Title: 2023 was a good year financially and now we have an inspiring new CEO
Pros:
diverse, dedicated, and often passionate people
respectfull work environment
interesting work - Automotive navigation, automated driving, fleet telematics, driver safety
Cons:
People are spread around the world so the window for talking is more limited
We tend to over complicate things
Sometimes people get passionate about their area of the business -- a product, a service, a messaging campaign -- but might not remember hat everything we do is to serve the customer

Review Title: Very positive environment and great leadership
Pros: Great benefits, competitive pay, positive team to work with and the people I've met live up to their culture: Be Bold, Be True, Learn Fast, Give Back, Win Together. Management I have interacted with are transparent and are open to different perspectives.
Cons: Challenging learning curve. Many complex systems and programs to learn but that is somewhat the norm with SaaS companies.

Review Title: Good company to make a career
Pros: Work like balance and competitive salary and benefits.
Cons: There is room for improvement in management.

Pros:
Remote and hybrid arrangements. 
Globally run company. 
Working with geospatial data and services that will continue to be in demand.
Cons: The satisfaction you get from your job depends on your role and team. Some teams are constantly fire-fighting, others can be quite chill. So a good or bad review on this site should be taken with a grain of salt. That said I'm enjoying working at this company.

Pros: My mentor was a seasoned professional, and I learnt a lot from him

Pros:
During my tenure at HERE I've found the culture to be exactly what I was looking for and couldn't be happier. With open communication and a collaborative environment, leadership provides strong direction, while getting to know you as an individual. They help foster your development goals while ensuring you exceed your objectives. Team members are supportive and understanding as you get up-to-speed learning the organization and the industry. Tons of flexibility too, while they encourage work/life balance. 

Additional benefits:
- Department Executives want to hear from team members as recurring skip-level conversations take place throughout the year.
- Summer Hours - Work some extra time Mon - Thurs and get Friday afternoons off!
- Opportunity to work anywhere in the world on a temporary basis, I believe the time limit is 30 days.
- Sabbatical opportunity after a certain duration with the company.
Cons: The organization has gone through many changes so you have to be flexible and adaptable as all of the processes may not be well defined. You also need to be prepared that there are personal changes due to the "great resignation", as well as reorganizations. If you aren't open to taking early morning or late night calls, this global environment may not be for you. I've found that the team really works together to understand and address these challenges head-on and what's needed to accomplish the objectives.

Pros: Good place to work. Went through some transition when I left.
Cons: Work force was going through changes.

Pros: There is here and there is here

Review Title: I did great work for them, not sure if they know what to do with it
Pros: I had interesting work coming my way on a very regular basis, and the larger team I worked with was the most apolitical, and respectful group I think I've ever worked with.
Cons: The company has been trying to reinvent itself every couple years, and I don't think the C-suite and the rest of the leadership team really knows what they want to be or how to get there.  Plenty of projects we worked on were deprioritized, paused, and in so many other ways kept from finding their way to production.

Pros: Great people, had a chance to pick technologies for my team

Pros: Great team members and great technology

Pros: Can't think of any right now.
Cons: Too much process, not enough innovation. Top-heavy with executives that say much and do little.

Pros:
Unlimited PTOs, there are people even take 1 month's PTO without any issue.
Besides some senior managers, most people are friendly and easy to work with.
Cons:
1. The managers I have worked with during the 4 year are all micro-management. 
2. Very unfriendly to foreign employees. 
H1b: lawyer response email WITHOUT any time manner, and immigration HR never response my direct message or email, which result in a lot of REF H1b cases.
GreenCard: When join the company, both HR and manager said after 6 month we can start the GC process, but then they start to find different kinds of excuses to delay the case. Then 4 years later, that's when my H1b has less than 2 years left, they said they can start my process, but I need to sign an agreement saying: if during the whole process, if I left Here, I need to pay all expense for my case.
3. Bad benefits, beside base salary and basic insurance, no other benefits at all. There is even a cut of 5% of your salary since pandemic happen and they are laying off 5% of people now.
4. Not very much tech skill you will learn here, most are business logic.

All foreigners be careful of this company, if you need working visa or green card sponsorship, this company will give you a lot of hard time. And put you in a very bad situation.

Pros: Work - life balance, DTO, health benefits
Cons: Senior leadership lacking, constant layoffs especially in the US to balance out the books, company vision / goals change year to year with no achievements

Pros: Flexibility was ok, wfh was allowed.

Review Title: Decent pay, but poor job stability.
Pros:
Above average pay - if you ask for it at the start

Good benefits and 401K

DTO is dependent on manager and department
Cons:
Horrible office layout - shoulder to shoulder seating.

A lot of lay-offs.

Employees all quit after 2-3 years.

Almost zero career upward mobility opportunities.

Unethical leadership at Director and Executive level - willing to hurt and stress employees in the name of "getting the job done". Even if it's a poorly done job.

Makes claims of positive culture, but doesn't live it.

Company is doing "fine" as is, but has a hard time actually leveling up its technology and reach.

Pros:
- Large company but still feels somewhat close knit
- Their map-based products that have been the backbone of the company are still the industry standard
- Generous separation package during most recent layoffs
Cons: - Recent layoffs were a bad sign. Full disclosure: I was one of those laid off, but it was the employees who were being kept that seemed almost more upset, as they had a significant amount of work to make up for, and there was little direction around that transition.

Review Title: Awesome Office in Chicago, Flexible working culture, Employee Friendly
Pros:
- Senior Leadership is focused on making the company be a world-class leader in locations and maps data
- As a new joiner, competitive salary and benefits compared to most of the companies
- Quarterly reviews
- Technology-driven

The company has a lot of potential. A lot of Underground work is going on. Should be in a great position in the next 2 years.
Cons: - People leaving because of many reasons (re-org and salary match being the top most reason).

Pros:
Very nice, qualified people to work with
Interesting technology
Interesting job assignments
My line manager is the best
Cons:
Poor benefits; premiums for medical go way up every year, dental is subpar, DTO vacation plan is a disaster (previously Paid Time Off-PTO was better). Some managers don't want to let you go on vacation, Bonuses are nearly nonexistent, raises are a joke-get the highest review possible and you may get a 2% increase if you are lucky, no career path, poor internal training-you are on your own, Europe and India have better benefits than Chicago and don't get laid off at the rate Chicago employees do, as layoffs always start in the USA.

Quarterly layoffs and reorganizations indicate that the Leadership Team (LT) keeps trying things that don't work. Somehow, people manage to get their jobs done in spite of this.

The LT conducted a focus team for the survey with the intent to get more good survey responses. The focus team was told at the outset not to bother evaluating any questions that were LT related, just make suggestions for what people at our level could do to help. Management also had a shadow team who the original focus team was unaware of, that filtered the suggestions made so not to offend the LT. 

Upper level executives keep disappearing from the company, but the ones who need to go are still there at the highest levels. 

The car consortium who owns the company had promised not to interfere in our daily operations when they bought the company, but they are always interferring. I have heard in meetings many times that we have to stop what we are doing and work on something for one of the owners.

 Getting promoted from within is nearly impossible. Make sure if you accept a job here, you get the salary you want and you are hired in at the level you want to be at 5 years from now. Then at the end of 5 years, you may be ok.

Pros: Great people makes for a really nice culture Interesting technology Good work Great benefits and good compensation Leadership cares for employees and the overall impact to society
Cons: Tends to struggle with the macroeconomics Needs to grow

* Everyone's ideas are heard as part of the day-to-day processes

* You can't help but learn new things every day
Cons: * Had some funding conflicts which held back certain projects that needed to be done.

Review Title: It was great, until the regime changed
Pros:
Executive leadership managed the company through covid well. They began monitoring the situation and beefing up their IT systems weeks before the pandemic began and swiftly transitioned everyone to work from home. 

Here also had a very inclusive culture.
Cons: Gender diversity among leadership has gone backward quite a bit during the past 2 years. A toxic good old boy culture has taken hold at the VP level.

Pros: easy sometimes, kind of fun sometimes
Cons: hard, but worth it sometimes

Review Title: Not a Bad Place to Work
Pros: A very international environment where you work with people in many different countries and cultures.  A European POV in terms of how employees are treated - very generous time off and paid holidays.
Cons: A difficult place to get things done - the organization tries, but the various groups are a bit silo'ed.   Also some decline in the Automotive business due to Google / Apple and the company has pivoted to focus on other industries but is a ways off for meaningfully breaking into those industries.

Pros:
In the 3 months I have been at HERE, what stands out most is the people. There is a great culture that is focused on the customer and getting stuff done. Everyone has been very willing to go out of their way to help me get onboarded and contributing as much as possible.

The work is interesting and fast paced - which I like. Cool technology and opportunity to work with some of the top automotive and technology companies around the world.

The company is very global and flexible with working remotely.
Cons:
The usual challenges of trying to do as much as possible with limited resources. 

At times, you may need to join meetings pretty early (6am) or in the evenings, depending on the location of teammates and customers you are working with.

Pros: Flexible time off policy, decent benefits
Cons: Engineering team is completely overworked, often clocking more than 60 hours a week. This is not helped by the line managers, who refuse to delegate tasks.

Pros: HERE offers a strong team environment with good training, cross selling and collaboration.
Cons: Innovation and product development lags behind the competition.

Review Title: Lots to learn, but management is confused
